conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graph for two objects, A and B, moving in the same direction along a straight line.
The graph shows the velocity v on the vertical axis and time t on the horizontal axis with two distinct curves labeled A and B.
Identify the characteristics of the velocity-time graph for each object.
Velocity is the rate of change of position, showing direction and speed of objects over time.
Determine the difference in displacement between the two objects as the absolute difference between their final and initial positions.
Analyze if the difference in displacement between the two objects is increasing continuously by checking the difference between their final and initial positions over time.
If the velocity of each object is constant, the difference in displacement will be constant; if the velocity changes, the difference will increase.
Since the velocity of object A is greater than that of object B at any given time, the difference in displacement will increase as time progresses.
Conclude that the difference in displacement between the two objects is not necessarily continuously increasing, but rather increases over time due to changing velocity.
